qas.question: How much glacial ice is found surrounding the poles?

How much of Earth's land surface do glaciers cover?

plausible_answers.text: ice sheets in the polar regions

qas.question: Where is 99% of the world snow contained?
What can be found on every continent of the world?
What percentage of the polar regions land surface is covered with glaciers?
What Connie Is Covered by 13,000,000 mi.² of glaciers?
Between what one want to latitudes or glaciers only found in valleys?

context: On Earth, <a0_0>99%<a0_0/> of glacial ice is contained within vast <b5_0>ice sheets in the polar regions<b5_0/>, but <b6_0>glaciers<b6_0/> may be found in mountain ranges on every continent except <a1_0>Australia<a1_0/>, and on a few high-latitude oceanic islands. Between <b9_0>35°N and 35°S,<b9_0/> glaciers occur only in the Himalayas, Andes, Rocky Mountains, a few high mountains in East Africa, Mexico, New Guinea and on Zard Kuh in Iran. Glaciers cover <a2_0>about <b7_0>10 percent<b7_0/><a2_0/> of Earth's land surface. Continental glaciers cover nearly 13,000,000 km2 (5×10^6 sq mi) or about <a4_0>98 percent<a4_0/> of <b8_0>Antarctica's<b8_0/> 13,200,000 km2 (5.1×10^6 sq mi), with an average thickness of <a3_0>2,100 m (7,000 ft)<a3_0/>. Greenland and Patagonia also have huge expanses of continental glaciers.
